intro: Erigeron semibarbatus var. semibarbatus, commonly known as the semibarbatus fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its hairy leaves and compact growth habit help it survive in arid conditions.
